div.div: This is an info panel of sorts, but mostly a placeholder for the readme!

div.h3: Oh no! Our casters are out of mana! Or maybe the developers are behind schedule?

ul.li: Paladins, Assassins, and Barbarians have a melee attack. They may attack any unit in the front rank. To attack the back rank with a melee attack, the target unit must not be covered. A back-row unit is covered when it has an ally in front on the right or the left.
Druids and Amazons have a ranged attack. They may attempt to attack any unit, but attacks against the back rank have a chance to be blocked by any unit covering that unit. Drat!
Necromancers and Mages have a very weak homing attacks. These cannot be blocked by the front rank!
You go first each round. When all units are out of turns, the round ends, and a new round begins.
This should be pretty easy, but you will likely suffer casualties. Chance plays a role! (The battle would be a lot harder if the programmer had enough time to implement better AI...)

This ain't Playstation 7. What did you want, CSS effects and highlights on hover/focus for everything you could possibly want to know? Be grateful that you don't have to type out commands manually and use your imagination for the graphics like it's 1984 or whenever. Click your unit, then click your target to attack. If your chosen unit doesn't have a turn left, you won't do anything, but you won't get punished either. (At least I hope not. That would be a bug.)
